@graph.title: Gabriel García Márquez in retrospect : a collection
@graph.abstract: Introduction. García Márquez: his vast range, his varied legacy / Gene H. Bell-Villada -- Oeuvre, backgrounds, legacy. García Márquez: writer for the world / Nicholas Birns and Juan de Castro -- Politics and death across the life of writing / Regina Janes -- Translation and apprenticeship / Edith Grossman -- García Márquez and Mamagallismo: on fatigued roosters, resistance. Sense of humor, and the Colombian personality / Marcela Velasco -- Re-reading the history of Macondo. Names and narrative pattern in One hundred years of solitude / Gene H. Bell-Villada -- The enlightened blindness of Úrsula Iguarán / Maria Delmar López-Cabrales -- Satire, ecocentrism, and luddite discourse in One hundred years of solitude: regional approaches for a global environmental crisis / William Flores -- Rediscovering ice: García Márquez, Aira, and Vallejo. On childhood memories / Héctor Hoyos -- Later works. After the end: Boløvar in the Labyrinth of history / Michael Wood -- The magic of love, the horrors of death, and other themes in the short stories of García Márquez / by Rubén Pelayo -- Gastronomical pilgrims / Fernando Valerio-Holguøn -- Reading illness in Gabriel García Márquez's Of love and other demons / Olivia Vasquez-Medina -- Magical realism as a simple tool to elicit humor in Of love and other demons / Ignacio López-Calvo -- Other genres, other media. The permutations of the fictional, non-fictional, and autobiographical "I" in the works of Gabriel García Márquez / Robert L. Sims -- Doomed from the start: big-screen adaptations of two García Márquez novels / Rudyard Alcocer and Haley Osborn -- Remembering Broadway's chronicle of a death foretold / Zhanna Gurvich
